owl:Ontology.terms:description:
The Building Performance Ontology (BOP) aims to enable the integration of topological building information with static and dynamic properties, to create a homogeneous data environment used by complex building performance assessments. It helps building managers and their software to deal with the large heterogeneity of information.
While the data describing static and dynamic properties is fundamentally different, they share a similar context with a complex spatio-temporal resolution. The goal of this ontology is to represent this complex contextual information similarly for different types of information, which will increase the opportunities for using the linked data in complex equations and improves machine-readability. We tried to be as semantically correct as possible, while also aiming for simple and intuitive queries. By (re-)using concepts from major ontologies in the field, BOP could easily be integrated with a wide range of existing ontologies and datasets.
owl:Ontology.terms:title: Building Performance Ontology

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between an actuator and the property it acts on.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: acts on

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between an actuation and the actuator which performed this actuation.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: actuated by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between an actuation and the actuated property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: actuated property

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a property set and a property which is part of this set.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: contains property

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between an execution and the executor which performed this execution.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: executed by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between an execution and the executed property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: executed property

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between an executor and the property it executes on.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: executes on

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a property and a corresponding actuation.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has actuation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a database and its collection.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has collection
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: E.g. the relationship between an InfluxDB database and an InfluxDB bucket.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Direct relationship between a feature of interest and a result.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has complex property
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example:
The object property could be extended by subclassing it with use-case-specific object properties.
One could for example say: :Wall --ex:hasLength-> :CurrentWallLength, where ex:hasLength is a subclass of bop:hasComplexProperty.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a property and a corresponding execution.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has execution

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking an executor with the database its results are stored in.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has external database
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: This object property could be used to link a sensor with a time-series database.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking an execution with its feature of interest.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has feature of interest

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a property and a corresponding observation.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has observation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a feature of interest with its property. The property is intrinsic to this feature of interest, and cannot exist without a feature of interest.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has property

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a property with a result
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has property state
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example:
This object property is used to directly link a property to a property state.
Example: Temperature -- hasPropertyState --> CurrentTemperatureState

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking an execution to its result.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has result

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Describing a whole-part relationship between an actuator and its sub-actuator.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has sub-actuator

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Describing a whole-part relationship between an executor and its sub-executor.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has sub-executor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Describing a whole-part relationship between a property and its sub-property..
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has sub-property

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Describing a whole-part relationship between a sensor and its sub-sensor..
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has sub-sensor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a result with a unit.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has unit

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Describing the relation between a platform and the executor which is hosted by this platform.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hosts
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: This object property could be used to describe the relationship between a wall and a sensor hosted by this wall.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Describing the relation between a procedure and the executor implementing this procedure.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: implemented by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Describing the relationship between an executor and the procedure it implements.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: implements procedure

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a property and the actuator which acts on the property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is actuated by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a collection with the database it is part of.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is collection of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a result with a feature of interest
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is complex property of
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example:
This object property is used to directly link the current state of a property to a feature of interest. It is the shortest route to link a result to a feature of interest. The object property could be extended by subclassing it with use-case-specific object properties.
One could for example say: :CurrentWallLength --ex:isLengthOf-> :Wall, where ex:hasLength is a subclass of bop:isComplexPropertyOf.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a property and the executor which executes on the property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is executed by
is external database of
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: Linking a database with the executor which results are stored in this database.
This object property could be used to link a time-series database with a sensor.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a feature of interest with an execution which executes on a property of this feature of interest.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is feature of interest of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Describing the relation between an executor and the platform hosting this executor.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is hosted by
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: This object property could be used to describe the relationship between a sensor and a wall hosting this sensor.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a property and the sensor which observes the property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is observed by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a property and the property set it is part of.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is part of property set

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a property with its feature of interest. The property is intrinsic to this feature of interest, and cannot exist without a feature of interest.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is property of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a result with a property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is property state of
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example:
This object property is used to directly link the current state of a property to a property. It is the shortest route to link a result to a property.
Example: CurrentTemperatureState -- isPropertyStateOf --> Temperature

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a result with an execution.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is result of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between an actuator and sub-actuators. The sub-actuators are of type actuator and could function as individual actuators.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is sub-actuator of
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: The object property could be used to model actuators which have multiple components with their own functions.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between an executor and sub-executors. The sub-executors are of type executor and could function as individual executors.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is sub-executor of
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: The object property could be used to model devices which have multiple components with their own functions. A multisensor - for example - consists of multiple sub-sensors which individually perform a sensing function.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a sub-property and its parent property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is sub-property of
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: The object property describes a typical whole-part relationship between a property and its sub-properties. It is used in cases where properties are so complex that it is desirable to decompose them into separate properties. The separate properties might also be individually linked to their own results.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a sensor and sub-sensors. The sub-sensors are of type sensor and could function as individual sensors.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is sub-sensor of
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: The object property could be used to model sensors which have multiple components with their own functions.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a unit with a result.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is unit of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The relationship between a procedure and an execution which used this procedure.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is used for

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between an observation and the sensor which performed this observation.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: observed by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between an observation and the observed property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: observed property

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a sensor and the property it observes.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: observes

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between an actuator and the actuation it performs.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: performs actuation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between an executor and the execution it performs.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: performs execution

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a sensor and the observation it performs.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: performs observation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The relationship between an execution and the used procedure.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: uses procedure

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a feature of interest with a simple property value described as a literal.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has simple property

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a property with a simple property state value described as a literal.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has simple property state

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking an execution with a simple result value described as a literal.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has simple result

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Linking a result with a unit described by a literal.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has simple unit

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The simple value of a result.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has value

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An act of carrying out an actuation procedure by an actuator to change the state of a property.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Actuation
Bediening

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An agent that can implement an actuation procedure to change the state of a property..
Iets wat een actie kan uitvoeren op basis van een procedure om de status van een eigenschap te veranderen.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Actuator
Actuator

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A collection of documents in a database.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Collectie
Collection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The most recently defined state of a property.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Current state
Huidige staat

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A collection of data.
The database class is used to describe an external database, storing results of executions, such as a time-series database.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Databank
Database

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An act of carrying out a procedure by an executor on a property
Het doen of uitvoeren van iets. Een uitvoering kan worden uitgevoerd door een uitvoerder, eventueel op basis van een procedure.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Execution
Uitvoering

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An agent that can implement a procedure to perform an execution.
Iets wat een taak kan uitvoeren op basis van een procedure.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Executor
Uitvoerder

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An abstraction of a real-world phenomenon which could be described in terms of its properties.
Een abstractie van een fenomeen uit de echte wereld (object, onderdeel, zone, evenement, etc).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Feature of interest
Kenmerk van belang
owl:Class.skos:example: An object, part, zone, event etc.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A function of a feature of interest.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Functie
Function

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An act of carrying out an observation procedure by a sensor to observe the state of a property.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Observatie
Observation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An entity that hosts an executor.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Platform
Platform

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A workflow, protocol, plan, algorithm, or computational method specifying how to perform an execution.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Procedure
Procedure

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A measurable and intrinsic characteristic of a feature of interest.
Een kenmerk van een feature of interest. Het kenmerk is intrinsiek aan en kan niet bestaan zonder de feature of interest.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Eigenschap
Property

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A collection of properties. The collection could also be a singleton or a null set.
Een collectie van eigenschappen. De collectie kan ook een eenpuntsverzameling of een lege verzameling zijn.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Property set
Verzameling van eigenschappen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The outcome of an execution.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Result
Resultaat
owl:Class.skos:example: The result may hold, for example, a value, a unit, a result time and other provenance data.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An agent that can implement an observation procedure to measure the state of a property.
Iets wat een meting kan uitvoeren op basis van een procedure om de status van een eigenschap te meten.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sensor
Sensor

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A particular quantity value that has been chosen as a scale for measuring other quantities of the same kind.
Een specifieke waarde van een natuurkundige grootheid die is gekozen als een schaal voor het meten van andere hoeveelheden van diezelfde grootheid.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Eenheid
Unit
